intro: Ouratea oblita, commonly known as the velvetleaf ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant's ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
